item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

item.title: 中国承诺加快购买未售出房屋用于公共住房
item.description: 中国住房监管机构承诺加快购买未售出的公寓，并将其转为经济适用房，这是中国为缓解创纪录的房地产低迷所做的最新努力。【原文：China’s housing regulator pledged to speed up the purchase of unsold apartments and turn them into affordable housing, its latest effort to cushion a record property slump.】

item.title: 印度股市将延续连胜势头，逼近历史新高
上田表示日本利率可能走高，日元攀升
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫表示，如果经济和物价符合央行的预期，央行仍将进一步加息，日元兑美元的涨幅扩大至 0.7%。【原文：The yen extended its gains to as much as 0.7% against the dollar as Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the central bank is still on a path toward further interest rate hikes if the economy and prices are in line with its expectations.】

item.title: 中国钢铁行业陷入危机，中国暂停新增钢铁产能
item.description: 中国政府突然暂停了新钢铁厂的审批制度，以应对需求大幅下滑导致的行业利润崩溃和出口激增。【原文：China has abruptly suspended its system for approving new steel plants, as the government responds to a deep demand slump that’s crushed industry profits and fueled a surge of exports.】

item.title: 万科将显示房地产危机对中国银行的严重影响
item.description: 中国万科集团股份有限公司和中国海外发展有限公司在公布财报时将继续为中国房地产业描绘一幅悲观的图景，显示出政府刺激政策的局限性。【原文：China Vanke Co. and China Overseas Land & Investment Ltd. should continue to paint a pessimistic picture of China’s property sector when they report earnings, showing the limits of the government’s stimulus efforts.】

item.title: 印度的 "甜蜜点 "吸引了全球市场动荡中的债券基金
item.description: 全球基金已连续 14 周将资金注入印度债市，这是今年以来的第二次连续买入，证明了印度在全球金融市场动荡之际的吸引力。【原文：Global funds have poured money into India’s debt market for 14 weeks in a second streak of buying this year, evidence of the country’s appeal amid the ructions of worldwide financial markets.】

item.title: 外国人抛售亚洲股票，印尼和马来西亚成为异类
item.description: 本月，随着全球投资者减少对亚洲几乎所有其他市场的投资，印度尼西亚和马来西亚的股票成为亚洲的亮点。【原文：Equities in Indonesia and Malaysia are standing out as bright spots in Asia this month as global investors trim their exposure to almost every other market in the region.】

item.title: 卖空者退却预示着比亚迪股价将在盈利前上涨
item.description: 做空者对比亚迪公司股票的押注正在失去信心，如果比亚迪下周的业绩一如预期，其表现可能会继续优于其他中国电动汽车股票。【原文：Short-sellers are losing conviction on bets against BYD Co. shares, which may continue to outperform other Chinese electric-vehicle stocks if its results next week are as good as expected.】

item.title: 澳大利亚财长向反对党提出通过改革的澳大利亚央行协议
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）表示，他已就储备银行改革问题向自由党-国民党反对派提出让步，以争取其支持立法改革，结束长达数月的僵局。【原文：Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers said he has offered the Liberal-National opposition concessions on reforms to the Reserve Bank in an effort to secure its support for legislative changes and end a monthslong deadlock.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴下周将把香港上市转为主板上市
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）股东已批准一项计划，将于8月28日将其香港上市地位提升至主要地位，预计这一举措将吸引来自中国大陆的数十亿美元投资。【原文：Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. shareholders have approved a plan to upgrade its Hong Kong listing to primary status on Aug. 28, a maneuver expected to attract billions of dollars in investment from mainland China.】

item.title: 花旗银行和蒙特利尔银行协助亚洲国际投资银行首次发行 3 亿美元数字债券
item.description: 亚洲基础设施投资银行（Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank）在花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：The Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank raised $300 million in its first bond issuance underpinned by blockchain technology, aided by Citigroup Inc. and BMO Capital Markets.】

item.title: Seven & I 收购提案考验日本对 M&A 的承诺
item.description: 对 Seven & i 控股公司的拟议收购可能导致日本最强大的品牌之一被出售，这是对日本不断变化的投资者友好立场的第一次重大考验。【原文：A proposed takeover of Seven & i Holdings Co. that could result in the sale of one of Japan’s strongest brands marks the first big test of the country’s evolving investor-friendly stance.】

item.title: 香港法律人才外流，法律专业学生无处可去
item.description: 早在 2018 年，当 Katie Lam 决定攻读什么专业时，她认为法律专业将为她未来的职业生涯打开最广阔的大门。当她被香港中文大学所选专业录取时，她欣喜若狂。【原文：When Katie Lam was deciding what to study back in 2018, she thought that a Law degree would open the most doors in a future career. She was overjoyed to be accepted into her chosen subject at the Chinese University of Hong Kong.】

item.title: 这太糟糕了就业数据失误引发华尔街愤怒
item.description: 目前，华尔街的日程表上不乏影响市场的事件，让华尔街忙得不可开交。【原文：There’s no shortage of market-moving events on the docket to keep Wall Street busy right now.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。交易员们在等待鲍威尔的杰克逊霍尔讲话。股市挣扎，债券收益率攀升。新兴市场货币也在下滑。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Traders await Powell’s Jackson Hole speech. Bond yields climb as stocks struggle. EM currencies also slide. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 石油因需求担忧和加沙谈判而每周下跌
item.description: 由于需求前景充满挑战，以及美国为确保加沙停火所做的努力，原油在周中创下自一月份以来的最低收盘价后，又开始了一周的下跌。【原文：Oil headed for a weekly loss — after hitting the lowest close since January midweek — on a challenging demand outlook, and US efforts to secure a cease-fire in Gaza.】

item.title: 瑞银激进主义银行家前往美国银行和富国银行任职
item.description: 据知情人士透露，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）在美国的激进主义辩护团队成员已被竞争对手银行挖走。【原文：UBS Group AG has lost members of its activism defense team in the US to rival banks, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: GE Vernova 在英国海上风电场再次发生叶片故障
item.description: 英格兰东北海岸附近的一个海上风力发电场的涡轮叶片发生故障，这是一连串类似事故中的最新一起，损害了公众对这一举步维艰的行业的认可。【原文：A turbine blade failed at an offshore wind farm near England’s northeast coast, the latest in a string of similar accidents that has damaged public acceptance of the struggling industry.】

item.title: 罢工和暴雨导致航班延误，澳大利亚糖业遭受重创
item.description: 主要产区的罢工和暴雨延误了澳大利亚的榨糖期，威胁到出口和农民种植明年作物的能力。【原文：Strikes and heavy rainfall across key growing areas are delaying Australia’s sugar crush, threatening exports and farmers’ ability to plant next year’s crops.】

item.title: 交易员反思美联储加息速度，股票和债券下跌：市场综述
item.description: 在杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）出席杰克逊霍尔会议之前，市场调整了对美国降息步伐的押注，亚洲股市周五早盘面临下跌。【原文：Asian equities faced early declines on Friday after markets adjusted wagers on the pace of US interest-rate cuts ahead of Jerome Powell’s Jackson Hole appearance.】

item.title: 日本战略家从市场影响角度衡量领导人选
item.description: 日本执政党自民党将在下个月的选举中选出新的领导人，这次选举可能会左右国防类股票的走势，提振共享出行服务公司的股价，并有助于决定日元的走势。【原文：Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party will select a new leader next month in an election that may sway defense stocks, bolster shares of ride-sharing services and help determine the trajectory of the yen.】

item.title: 大使警告阿姆鲁法案将给墨西哥司法机构带来贩毒集团风险
item.description: 据一位美国高级官员称，如果由民众投票选举法官的计划获得批准，贩毒集团将更容易渗透到墨西哥的司法机构中。【原文：Drug cartels will find it easier to infiltrate Mexico’s judiciary if a plan to have judges elected by popular vote is approved, according to a senior US official.】

item.description:
在这部彭博原创迷你纪录片中，我们将探讨货币和 "利差交易 "是如何引发全球市场恐慌的。【原文：

In this Bloomberg Originals mini-documentary, we explore how the currency and the “carry trade” managed to trigger a global market panic.

item.title: 加拿大命令铁路公司成立劳工机构以结束停工
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）的政府出面试图结束加拿大最大的两家铁路公司的停工，这次停工导致铁路交通陷入停顿。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government stepped in to try to end a work stoppage at Canada’s two largest railways that has brought rail traffic to a halt.】

item.title: 货币市场基金本月迄今吸引了 1,060 亿美元资金
item.description: 由于投资者在美联储开始降息前锁定了高收益率，货币市场基金中的现金数额在 8 月份迄今为止激增了 1,000 多亿美元，资产规模创下历史新高。【原文：The amount of cash in money-market funds has surged by more than $100 billion so far in August, pushing assets to a record as investors lock in lofty yields before the Federal Reserve starts cutting interest rates.】

item.title: Blackstone 旗下 BREIT 任命 Wesley LePatner 为首席执行官，接替 Cohen 的职位
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 的富豪房地产信托公司表示，Wesley LePatner 将出任首席执行官，自 1 月 1 日起生效。【原文：Blackstone Inc.’s real estate trust for wealthy individuals said Wesley LePatner will become chief executive officer, effective Jan. 1.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚央行行长称巴西货币政策是应避免的榜样
item.description: 安第斯国家的一位最高决策者表示，巴西央行是该地区最早削减利率的国家之一，现在可能需要再次提高利率，巴西央行所犯的错误为哥伦比亚提供了一个警示。【原文：Mistakes made by Brazil’s central bank, which was among the first in the region to slash interest rates and may now need to lift them again, provide a cautionary tale for Colombia, according to one of the Andean nation’s top policymakers.】

item.title: Wamco 对三年内 17,000 笔交易的调查
item.description: 西方资产管理公司（Western Asset Management Co.【原文：Western Asset Management Co. is examining a subset of about 17,000 trades conducted by Ken Leech as the firm seeks to unravel how the veteran fixed-income investor’s allocations among various accounts triggered US enforcement investigations.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克对 9 月降息持 "非常开放 "态度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马丁斯-卡扎克表示，他已准备好在下个月的会议上讨论再次降息的问题，并表达了对通胀率重返2%的信心以及对经济的担忧。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said he’s ready to discuss another reduction in interest rates at next month’s meeting, voicing confidence in inflation returning to 2% as well as worries over the economy.】
